meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

Welcome back to my humble abode of gaming reviews, where the coffee flows like the tears of a hopeless romantic and the laughter echoes through the halls of pixelated passion. Today, we're diving into the sweet and spicy world of Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling, a delightful Otome visual novel that has captured the hearts of many, including yours truly.

But before I dive into the nitty-gritty, let's take a quick peek at what some of my esteemed colleagues have to say. Over at NintendoWorldReport, our friend gave it an 80, praising the game's ability to subsume its original self like Pokémon Platinum did to Diamond and Pearl (yes, I had to look up that analogy too). Meanwhile, God is a Geek thinks it's "wonderful" but only for those who played the first Cupid Parasite. Ah, poor souls who missed out on the initial romance!

Moving on, Cubed3 awarded Sweet and Spicy Darling a whopping 90, citing its balanced storytelling, varied plot routes, and Lynette's married life being relatable (who wouldn't want to read about that?). Digitally Downloaded also gave it a perfect score, gushing over its unique art style and presentation. Gamer Escape, on the other hand, was more reserved, giving it a 60 and saying it should've been DLC instead of a full-fledged sequel.

Now, where's my review? Ah yes! Let me get cozy with Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling, and see if I can find the romance in its many routes. As someone who never played the original (oops, what a terrible reviewer!), I was pleasantly surprised to find that this game is surprisingly self-contained, with enough context and reminders to help me along the way.

The gameplay itself is where Sweet and Spicy Darling truly shines. With its colorful palette and easy-to-use menus, it's an absolute delight to explore each route, making choices and reading stories like a rom-com novel. And let's not forget those endings – oh, the endings! A perfect blend of sweet, spicy, and balanced flavors (pun intended).

In conclusion, Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling is a must-play for anyone who loves romance, visual novels, or just wants to experience something new and exciting. It may have its quirks and criticisms, but trust me when I say that this game will leave you feeling warm and fuzzy inside (or maybe even give you a sweet tooth). So go ahead, indulge in the world of Cupid Parasite, and let your heart be swept away by the adventures of Lynette and her lovely suitors.
